item.title: Avoid using the following words on your resume: CareerBuilder
item.description:
A CareerBuilder survey found that almost 70% of hiring managers spend less than two minutes looking at resumes, meaning word choice is critical for job seekers. Rosemary Haefner, CareerBuilder’s VP of human resources, advises using strong action verbs that highlight specific experiences, skills, and achievements. She cautions against subjective terms and clich√©s because they fail to convey concrete information. For example, instead of claiming to be “results-driven,” demonstrate actual results...

item.title: First Advantage reported that ten percent of job candidates in the Asia Pacific region are dishonest
item.description:
First Advantage, a company that specializes in background verification, has found that over 10% of resumes from job applicants in the Asia Pacific region contain inconsistencies. This issue is particularly prominent in Australia, where 12% of candidates were found to have significant discrepancies on their resumes. The company noted a higher rate of alerts related to criminal records and employment history checks among Australian candidates compared to other countries. First Advantage recommends that companies implement screening practices not only to comply with industry regulations, ensure employee competence, and mitigate physical, legal, and financial risks but also to safeguard their brand reputation...
